intro: Pinguicula albiflora var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy white butterwort, is a carnivorous plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that secrete digestive enzymes to trap and digest small insects. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate floral element to its appearance. It thrives in moist, boggy environments and requires high humidity and partial shade for optimal growth. Its unique combination of carnivorous adaptations and ornamental features makes it a fascinating subject for botanical study.
